title: How many potatoes should you make per person for mashed potatoes? - Quora

response.answer_text: How many potatoes should you make per person for mashed potatoes? I can always use the leftovers, and my kids always loved spuds, so I’d do at least 2 large spuds per kid. A lot less for older folks, and other small appetites. But, it’s always better to make too much, rather than not enough. Spuds are cheap. Good tucker. You can just about live on them. == FWIW: reposted: ========= We had had to make do in the beginning. Mum cooked, Dad supplied:- I don’t know if you read my earlier story - Wayne T's answer to Have you ever run away from home? - but we were a bit poor and a bit remote when I was a young human. My dad used to travel 40 miles to the Victoria market by foot, bus and train, and come home with heavy sugar bags or potato sacks full of whatever vegies they’d sell off cheaply at the market’s close on a Saturday, (he had to feed 6 of us on bugger-all money. Our diet was very much ‘pot luck’ sometimes. We had chooks, ducks, and goats, too. The goats gave milk and more goats, the chooks gave eggs and chicks, but neither the ducks nor the chooks were long for this world once they were of ‘Sunday dinner’ size or not laying, and the younger goats were looking worried.) One week the market had a lot of cheap spuds and not much else. Dad bought bags full of the things. We were eating the damn spuds for a fortnight or more: Sauteed, fried, grilled, mashed, boiled, stuffed, barbecued, roasted, in pies, topping shepherds pies, deep-fried chips, and potato cakes, peeled and in their bloody jackets, and as bloody soups… Then he planted a bunch of those left over. At least we didn’t run out of ammo for our spud guns. Thank God for Mums and Dads… :) :) :)

It depends on how your fellow diners like mashed potatoes. I use one large russet potato for two people, but once cooked five pounds of russets for lunch for four people (thinking I would have leftovers to make potato cakes the next day). One of the guests, a young teen with a love for potatoes, dived into the pot and finished it off. There were no potato cakes the next day, but I had a happy young guest. Try to use russets, unless you are looking for a more plain and homey dish. The russets will be lighter and fluffy.
